text:
hey there!
I’m trying to add a method to the laplacian_matrix for convenience. It doesnt work if I do this:
`laplacian_matrix(A::Array{Float64,2}) = laplacian_matrix(SimpleWeightedGraph(A))`
but does work if i use:
`laplacian_matrix(A::Array{Float64,2}) = SimpleWeightedGraphs.laplacian_matrix(SimpleWeightedGraph(A))`
I’m unsure why the first does not work and was hoping someone might explain it to me? I’m using Pluto with julia 1.6 and both LightGraphs and SimpleWeightedGraphs are loaded in my environment

text:
I worked out that I needed to import LightGraphs.LinAlg.laplacian_matrix to override it. In vscode, i get a warning of
`An imported function has been extended without using module defined typed arguments.`
which seems to be referring to SimpleWeightedGraph. What’s the proper way to deal with this? Sorry, i’m relatively new to adding methods to functions!
